general.title: Allgemein
general.analyticsHintP1: Analysedaten helfen uns, besser zu verstehen wie die Benutzer mit Anori interagieren, und welche Funktionen am h√§ufigsten benutzt werden. Es werden keine pers√∂nlichen Informationen wie z.B. Notizen-Inhalte oder Lesezeichen-URLs geteilt.
general.analyticsHintP2: Das hilft uns, ein besseres Produkt zu entwickeln, also bitte aktiviere das Senden der Analysedaten.
general.stealFocusHint: Wenn diese Option aktiviert ist, wird der Browser gezwungen, den Fokus von der Adressleiste auf diese Seite zu verschieben, wenn eine neue Registerkarte ge√∂ffnet wird. Du kannst das Befehlsmen√º (Cmd+K) verwenden, ohne den Fokus manuell auf die Seite verschieben zu m√ºssen (durch Klicken oder Dr√ºcken von Tab).
general.automaticCompact: Automatischer Wechsel in den Kompaktmodus je nach Bildschirmgr√∂√üe

aboutHelp.title: Hilfe & √ºber Anori
aboutHelp.onlyEnglishPlease: I (author of the project) don't speak a lot of languages, so please file your issues in English. Thanks!
aboutHelp.p1: Anori ist eine freie und quelloffene Erweiterung. Der Quellcode liegt auf <0>GitHub</0>. Wenn Sie eine Funktion vorschlagen oder einen Fehler melden m√∂chten, erstellen Sie bitte ein neues <1>Issue</1> im Repository. Wenn Sie sich einfach nur bedanken wollen, k√∂nnen Sie diesem Repository einen Stern geben :).
aboutHelp.p2: Wenn Sie diese Erweiterung modifizieren oder ein eigenes Plugin oder Widget hinzuf√ºgen m√∂chten, lesen Sie bitte die <0>readme</0> f√ºr weitere Informationen.
aboutHelp.p3: Dem Autor auf<0>Twitter</0> folgen und die <1>Ukraine unterst√ºtzen</1>.

shortcuts.title: Shortcuts

shortcuts.addNewWidget: Neues Widget zum aktuellen Ordner hinzuf√ºgen

start.title: Welcome to Anori!
start.p1: Glad to see you! This introduction is available in {{languages}}.
start.p2: You're on your way to setup your ideal new tab. Anori start page consists of different widgets, like notes, bookmarks, todo lists, etc. You choose what to add and how to organize them.
start.p3: You can add your first widget by clicking on the pencil in the top right corner. This will switch the page into editing mode. Here you can add new widgets and reposition or remove existing ones.
start.p4: To add a new widget, click on the plus button, or click on the checkmark to exit editing mode. Once you add your first widget, this onboarding will disappear. You can add a widget right now and explore the extension on your own, or, if you'd like to know a bit more about the features Anori has to offer, click 'Next'.

folders.title: Folders
folders.p1: By default all your widgets are being added to the 'Home' folder. However, you can also organize your widgets in different folders. For example, you could have different folders for work and personal widgets. Or you could have a separate folder for each individual project.
folders.p2: To manage folders, click on a gears icon in the bottom left corner. This will open settings, where you can customize Anori to your liking. Click on 'Folders' there to open folders manager.

shortcuts.title: Shortcuts
shortcuts.p1: A lot of actions in Anori can be done using keyboard shortcuts.
shortcuts.p2: A bunch of widgets allow you to interact with them using a command menu. To open the menu, press {{metaKey}}+K. Once you add your first couple of widgets you'll be able to utilize its full power to open bookmarks, search, or mark tasks as completed using just your keyboard.
shortcuts.p3: By default, when you open a new tab, the browser's search bar will be active. Anori doesn't get any events when you type there, so to use shortcuts you'll need to move the focus to Anori page first and then press the shortcut keys. To move focus, you can press Tab or click anywhere on the page.
shortcuts.p4: If you would like to see the full list of shortcuts, you can find a cheatsheet in the 'Help' section of settings.

customization.title: Customization
customization.p1: While Anori lets you compose your own start page from widgets, it can be customized even more.
customization.p2: You can change the title of a new tab, change the color scheme along with background image and upload your custom icons to use in widgets (in addition to 10,000+ built-in icons).
customization.p3: And this isn't even half of the options. You might want to check out settings to see them all.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.p1: We're almost finished. But there is one final thing. By-default Anori doesn't collect any tracking data and doesn't send anything to remote servers. But I use analytics voluntarily sent by users to see what features are used the most and what needs a bit of polishing.
analytics.p2: Therefore I ask you to enable sending analytics. Anori doesn't send any private data (like your notes or URLs of your bookmarks), just the metrics on how you use the extension (e.g. how many folders you have and how often you use shortcuts). But this is completely up to you, Anori will work as usual even if you don't enable analytics.

presets.title: New start
presets.p1: That's all. Now you have an express bachelor's degree in Anori and are prepared to create your own start page. Add your first widget and start building the ultimate setup.
presets.p2: Tired of choices? It's okay. You don't need to nail down your perfect page on the first try. You don't even need to start from a blank canvas. We have a productive setup prepared for you.
presets.p3: It might not be tailored for all your needs, but you can use it as a base to make your own setup you'll love.
presets.cta: üöÄ Just give me a productive setup

rss-plugin.examplePostDescription1: Du f√§ngst einfach mit einem Lesezeichen an und l√§sst dich dann von deinem Herzen leiten. Manchmal braucht man nur ein bisschen Ordnung...
rss-plugin.examplePostDescription2: Heute zeige ich dir, wie du Ihren Browser mit diesen unverzichtbaren Erweiterungen in eine Produktivit√§tsstation verwandeln kannst. Mit dem Star der Show: Anori.
rss-plugin.examplePostTitle3: Eine Erweiterung, mit der du deinen eigenen neuen Tab aus Widgets zusammenstellen kannst!
